help.intro: Welcome to Elysium! Here are the available commands:
help.filters_text: âš™ï¸ Help: Filters Filters allow the bot to auto-reply when specific keywords are detected. Commands: â€¢ /filter <trigger> <reply> - Add filter â€¢ /stop <trigger> - Remove filter â€¢ /filters - List filters â€¢ /stopall - Remove all filters Trigger Types: â€¢ word - Match anywhere (default) â€¢ =word - Exact match â€¢ *word - Prefix match (starts with) Multi-Trigger: /filter (hi, hello, hey) Hello too! Button Format: /filter test Try this! {button:Click|https://...} Permission Tags: â€¢ {admin} - Admin only â€¢ {user} - Non-admin only â€¢ {protect} - Protected content â€¢ {replytag} - Tag replied user Example: /filter rules Read rules! {button:Rules|https://t.me/...}
help.notes_text: ğŸ“ Help: Notes Notes feature allows you to save messages, media, and buttons with shortcuts. Commands: â€¢ /save <name> <content> - Save new note â€¢ /get <name> - Get note (or use #name) â€¢ /notes - List all notes â€¢ /clear <name> - Delete note â€¢ /clearall - Delete all notes (admin only) â€¢ /privatenotes on/off - Send notes to PM Button Format: â€¢ {button:Text|URL} - One button â€¢ {button:A|URL}:{button:B|URL} - Same line â€¢ New line = new button row Example: /save rules Read rules! {button:Rules|https://t.me/...} Permission Tags: â€¢ {admin} - Admin only â€¢ {user} - Non-admin only Tips: â€¢ Use #name to call note quickly â€¢ Reply to a user when calling note to tag them
help.purge_text: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Help: Purge Delete multiple messages at once. Commands: â€¢ /purge - Delete from reply until now â€¢ /spurge - Silent purge (no validation) â€¢ /del - Delete replied message â€¢ /purgefrom - Mark start point â€¢ /purgeto - Delete from start point to here Usage: 1. Reply to start message 2. Type /purge 3. All messages from reply to command are deleted Note: Bot can only delete messages < 48 hours old.
help.rules_text: ğŸ“œ Help: Rules Manage group rules. Commands: â€¢ /rules - View rules â€¢ /setrules - Set rules (reply to message) â€¢ /clearrules - Delete rules â€¢ /setrulesprivate on/off - Send rules to PM Format: Supports buttons and placeholders like welcome. Use {button:Text|URL} for buttons. Integration: Use {rules} in welcome/notes to include rules.
help.warns_text: âš ï¸ Help: Warns Warning system to manage user violations. Basic Commands: â€¢ /warn [reason] - Warn user â€¢ /dwarn - Warn + delete message (reply) â€¢ /swarn - Silent warn â€¢ /warns [@user] - View user warnings â€¢ /rmwarn - Remove last warning â€¢ /resetwarn - Reset user's warnings â€¢ /resetallwarns - Reset ALL group warnings Settings: â€¢ /warnings - View settings â€¢ /warnmode [mode] - Change penalty mode â€¢ /warnlimit [number] - Change warning limit â€¢ /warntime [duration] - Warning validity duration Penalty Modes: â€¢ ban - Permanent ban â€¢ mute - Permanent mute â€¢ kick - Kick from group â€¢ tban [duration] - Temp ban â€¢ tmute [duration] - Temp mute Target: Reply to a message, or use @username / ID
help.welcome_text: ğŸ‘‹ Help: Welcome Welcome feature sends automated message when new member joins. Commands: â€¢ /welcome - View status & preview â€¢ /welcome on/off - Enable/disable â€¢ /setwelcome - Set message (reply to message) â€¢ /setwelcomebuttons - Set buttons â€¢ /resetwelcome - Reset to default Button Format: â€¢ {button:Text|URL} - One button â€¢ {button:A|URL}:{button:B|URL} - Same line (use :) â€¢ New line = new button row Placeholders: â€¢ {first} - First name â€¢ {last} - Last name â€¢ {fullname} - Full name â€¢ {mention} - Mention user â€¢ {id} - User ID â€¢ {group} - Group name â€¢ {count} - Member count Example: /setwelcome Welcome {mention} to {group}! {button:Rules|https://t.me/...}
help.admin_text: ğŸ›¡ï¸ Help: Admin Special commands for group administrators. ğŸ“š User Commands: â€¢ /kickme - Kick yourself from the group ğŸš« Ban Commands: â€¢ /ban - Ban user â€¢ /dban - Delete message & ban (reply) â€¢ /sban - Silent ban (delete command, no message) â€¢ /tban <time> - Temp ban (4m, 3h, 6d, 5w) â€¢ /unban - Unban user ğŸ”‡ Mute Commands: â€¢ /mute [time] - Mute user (optional duration) â€¢ /dmute - Delete message & mute (reply) â€¢ /smute - Silent mute (delete command) â€¢ /tmute <time> - Temp mute â€¢ /unmute - Unmute user ğŸ‘¢ Kick Commands: â€¢ /kick - Kick user â€¢ /dkick - Delete message & kick (reply) â€¢ /skick - Silent kick ğŸ“Œ Pin Commands: â€¢ /pinned - View pinned message â€¢ /pin [loud] - Pin message (add loud for notify) â€¢ /permapin <text> - Pin custom text â€¢ /unpin - Unpin message â€¢ /unpinall - Unpin all messages ğŸ‘‘ Admin Commands: â€¢ /promote - Promote to admin (reply) â€¢ /demote - Demote admin (reply) ğŸ“ Examples: â€¢ Mute @username for 2 hours: â†’ /tmute @username 2h â€¢ Silent ban ID 1234: â†’ /sban 1234
help.afk_text: ğŸ’¤ Help: AFK The AFK (Away From Keyboard) feature notifies others that you are inactive when they reply or mention you. Commands: â€¢ /afk [reason] - Set AFK status â€¢ /brb [reason] - Alias for /afk Example: /afk Sleeping /brb Lunch How to Return: Simply send any message in the group, AFK status will be removed automatically.
help.antiflood_text: ğŸŒŠ Help: Antiflood Automatic protection from message spam/flood. Commands: â€¢ /antiflood - View status â€¢ /setflood [count] - Set message limit â€¢ /setflood off - Disable â€¢ /setfloodpenalty [mode] - Set penalty Penalty Modes: â€¢ warn - Warning only â€¢ mute - Permanent mute â€¢ kick - Kick from group â€¢ ban - Permanent ban â€¢ tban [duration] - Temp ban How it works: If a user sends more than X messages in a short time, the penalty is applied. Bypass: Admins and approved users are immune to antiflood.
help.approval_text: âœ… Help: Approval Approval system to bypass antiflood. Commands: â€¢ /approve [@user] - Approve user â€¢ /unapprove [@user] - Remove approval â€¢ /approved - View approved users â€¢ /approval - Check your approval status â€¢ /unapproveall - Remove all approvals Benefits: â€¢ Immune to antiflood â€¢ Immune to spam limits Target: Reply to a message, or use @username / ID
help.bye_text: ğŸ‘‹ Help: Goodbye Goodbye feature sends an automated message when member leaves the group. Commands: â€¢ /bye - View status & preview â€¢ /bye on/off - Enable/disable â€¢ /setbye - Set message (reply to message) â€¢ /setbyebuttons - Set buttons â€¢ /resetbye - Reset to default Button Format: Same as welcome. Use {button:Text|URL} Placeholders: â€¢ {first}, {last}, {fullname} â€¢ {mention}, {id} â€¢ {group}, {count}
